text: did the scene of his terrible fire this
morning I wanted a briefing from the
emergency services they've been working
tirelessly in horrific conditions and
I've been overwhelmed by their
professionalism and their bravery I
heard stories of firefighters running
into the building being protected from
the falling debris by police officers
using their riot shields and we thank
some of all our emergency services for
the incredible work that they have done
I've also learned that now the number of
confirmed dead is 17 but it is expected
to rise further we know there are 37
people being treated across several
hospitals in London 17 of whom are
receiving critical care at times like
this the response of the community has
been extraordinary and it has shown the
great spirit of people in responding to
a tragedy such as this i've ordered that
the cross government group that is
meeting to ensure that the response is
properly coordinated we'll meet again
today they'll meet this afternoon and
the government stands ready to provide
every assistance necessary to the
emergency services and to the local
authority I know we've all heard
absolutely heartbreaking as I did this
morning heartbreaking stories of the
people who were caught up in this
terrible terrible tragedy and I want to
reassure the residents of Granville
Tower all of whom are in our thoughts
and prayers at the moment I want to
reassure them that the government will
make every effort to ensure that they're
rehoused in London and as close as
possible to home but right now people
have want answers and it's absolutely
right and that's why I am today ordering
a full public inquiry into this disaster
we need to know what happened we need to
know have an explanation of this we owe
that to the families to the people who
have lost loved ones friends and the
homes in which they lived in that quest
for answers some people are wondering
whether the government's decision to
delay the publication of the fire safety
report might have contributed to this
disaster and can you also guarantee to
local authorities that there will be
extra money for sprinklers in existing
high-rises what we need to do is to
ensure that
terrible tragedy is properly
investigated that's why I'm ordering a
full public inquiry so we can get to the
answers we can find out exactly what
happened and why it happened and it
became clear to me this morning that
that was necessary because when I
visited the theme and I spoke to the
emergency services they told me that
this fight that way this fire progressed
how it took hold of this building was
repaired it was ferocious and it was
unexpected so it is right that in
addition to the immediate fire report
that will be produced and any potential
police investigations that we do have a
full public inquiry to get to the bottom
of this why did this happen
people deserve answers the inquiry will
give them
